basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Martha Quintanilla-Ramirez; Iâ€™m 28 years old. I am a software developer with a finance background in Seattle, WA! Before switching careers, I worked for a credit union where I was a Retail Experience Support Specialist. I assisted over 100 personal bankers with complex transactions, utilizing my problem-solving skills and attention to detail. While this career has taught me a lot and has been rewarding, I decided to switch gears and become a software developer to challenge myself. I want to prove that I can succeed in the tech world and break down any myths/stereotypes regarding females in the tech industry. It is essential to bring diversity to any team I work with to empower other people from all walks of life. Technology is evolving rapidly, and I want to be a part of the growth and contribute in any way I can. Thank you ðŸ’œ

projects.title: About Me
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: The Running Shoe Guide
projects.description: The Running Shoe Guide walks the users through a questionaire to pair them up with 3 different pairs of running shoes  based on their selection. Used grid layout and Css to design the page, and used Javascript for the functionality. We created an information page to show case the difference in shoe comfortability. :)

projects.title: 301 Project Place holder
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
